data.meta_description: Boyle & Lowry, L.L.P. is a firm based in Irving, Texas that serves cities, special districts and other public entities. Contact a local government and municipal law attorney at 972-650-7100.
data.text:
Firm Overview

North Texas Local Government and Municipal Law

The roots of Boyle & Lowry go back to 1975 when John F.Boyle Jr. partnered with Ray Hutchison to form the law firm of Hutchison, Price, Boyle, and Brooks in Dallas. That law firm was the first in Texas to represent public entities collectively as general counsel, special counsel and as bond counsel. In 1995 John F. Boyle Jr. and L. Stanton Lowry formed Boyle & Lowry for the continuation of the practice of local government and municipal law.

At Boyle & Lowry, we believe in doing what we do best: getting positive results for public entities. To achieve these positive results, we provide accurate, efficient and timely advice and counsel on legal issues affecting our clients. Our mission is to assist clients in achieving their goals and objectives, subject to and limited by applicable law. We believe in public representation with a customized level of service that is best suited to each particular client's needs.

We are keenly aware of precedent-setting cases and changing legislation that continually affect municipalities and other local government entities. With more than 125 years of combined experience in the areas of municipal and local government law, our attorneys can develop innovative yet practical solutions that would be unknown to a general law firm. Our expertise also enables us to more efficiently accomplish the job and achieve the desired results: our years of experience let us provide quality results while charging competitive fees.

Boyle & Lowry was founded on the philosophy that effective representation demands focusing in on a specialized body of law. Our attorneys practice exclusively in the areas of municipal and local government law. Our expertise and particular emphasis includes:

Annexation and boundary issues

Economic development and incentives

Tax abatement

Public improvement districts

Land use, zoning and planning

Real estate development

Governmental contracts

Public works and construction

Eminent domain, inverse condemnation and regulatory takings

Employment and labor

Telecommunications, electric deregulation, public utility regulations and cable franchises

Water rights and drainage issues - Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (formerly TNRCC)

Municipal and local government regulation of gas and oil drilling

Elections

School Law

Constitutional claims and civil rights

Public finance and municipal bonds

Urban affairs

Legislative and administrative process

Open meetings and public records

Utility districts, water districts and special districts

Tort claims, wrongful death and personal injury

Trial and appellate litigation in state and federal courts

Building Long-Term Relationships

We know that client satisfaction depends on more than a single favorable outcome. Having a working relationship with our clients is also a critical component of long-term confidence and satisfaction. As a testament to our level of service and commitment to forming long-lasting relationships with our clients, we have, for many years, provided City Attorney services to a number of municipalities and public entities throughout Texas. In addition, serve as special counsel to numerous cities and local governments throughout the state of Texas for many years.

Responding to your needs is something we do best. Our lawyers pride themselves on keeping open lines of communication with our clients. All phone calls and e-mails are promptly returned. Legal opinions and documents are timely submitted. We keep you informed. Of equal importance, we are accessible. You can call on us before, during or after business hours and we will be available to help you.
